en.title: Triton's Treasure

en.task_contact-mc2: Contact Mission Control again using the radio
en.task_show-observations: Review your observations with Mission Control
en.i_ship: My trusty support ship. I can come here to rest or make repairs.
en.i_propellor: Something is tangled in the propellor. I should go back to the ship to fix it.
en.o_floating-kelp: There is a kelp forest here. It looks very dense.
en.o_sunlight-surface: Sunlight shines through the water's surface. The ocean is bright with blues and greens.
en.o_color-change: Blues and greens of the ocean begin to shift to darker hues, while the bright kelp fades to a murky olive color.
en.o_darkness: Ocean has become much darker, with most colors now barely visible.
en.o_shell: Met a talking shell! It doesn't seem very cheerful though.
en.sm-subheading: Click a step for more info.
en.sm-observation_def: Observation: a statement based on something you have seen, heard, or noticed.
en.sm-observation_desc: Make an observation about a phenomenon (something that exists or has happened).
en.sm-question_def: Scientific Question: a question that can be answered with empirical evidence.
en.sm-question_desc: Ask a scientific question based on your observations.
en.sm-hypothesis_def: Hypothesis: an educated guess of the answer to your scientific question.
en.sm-hypothesis_desc: Make a hypothesis based on your observations and science knowledge.
en.sm-experiment_def: Experiment: a test that changes one variable to observe what happens to another.
en.sm-experiment_desc: Plan and conduct an experiment to test your hypothesis.
en.sm-analysis_def: Analysis: a review of your data to find patterns or relationships.
en.sm-analysis_desc: Analyze the data from your experiment.
en.sm-conclusion_def: Conclusion: a summary statement that compares your hypothesis with the results of the experiment.
en.sm-conclusion_desc: Make a conclusion based on the results from your experiment and analysis.
en.np-cover_title: Mission: Explore the Triton's Triangle depths
en.ee_desc-1: Empirical evidence is data that is collected through observations and measurements in an experiment.
en.ee_desc-2: It is used to answer a scientific question and support a hypothesis.
en.np-cover_ee-1: Collecting both types of data is known as gathering:
en.np-cover_ee-2: By asking questions, and answering them with empirical evidence, we can understand the deep ocean better.
en.np-wrecks-notes_question: How does the color of the ocean change as I go deeper?
en.sub-creak-2: That sound just came from the sub's hull... that can't be good.
en.hint_radio-code: Click the Scientific Method steps in the correct order
en.item_desc_radio: A communication device for contacting Mission Control.
en.item_action_radio: Use this to ask for hints if you are stuck.
en.item_desc_sm: A diagram of the Scientific Method steps.
en.item_action_sm: Use this to review the Scientific Method steps.
en.item_desc_notepad: A tool for recording notes and empirical evidence.
en.item_action_notepad: Use this to record and review data.
en.item_desc_map: A map drawing of the Triton Triangle depths.

en.item_desc_dg: An instrument for measuring underwater depth.
en.item_desc_th: A device for measuring water temperature.
en.desc_shell:
A large sea snail with a horn-shaped shell.
There is something mysterious about this one...
en.desc_otter:
A cute marine mammal with thick fur.
Can live on land and in water.
en.newspaper-text-1: Renowned scientist Dr. Conch has gone missing during a deep sea expedition into the infamous Triton Triangle.
en.newspaper-text-2: Search teams found no trace of the scientist or his submarine.
en.newspaper-text-3: Little is known about the Triton's Triangle, but many tell of strange events, lurking sea monsters...
en.newspaper-text-4: ... and rumours of a treasure hidden deep below.
en.radio_no-signal: There is no signal here... maybe I should try again above water.
en.radio_signal-lost: Weird... lost the signal. Just when I was about to report something interesting.
en.tut_status-1: Mission Control, this is SM-Explorer. I have arrived at the Triton Triangle.
en.tut_status-2: Copy that, SM-Explorer. How are you feeling?
en.tut_status-3: Good... just a bit nervous. First time seeing this place in person.
en.tut_status-4: Understandable, this mission must mean a lot to you. Stay safe down there.
en.tut_mb-1: Your mission is to explore, and collect data about the depths of the Triton Triangle.
en.tut_elaborate-1: Our goal is to understand the deep ocean better.
en.tut_elaborate-2: As you explore deeper, conduct a series of experiments and collect both qualitative and quantitative data.
en.tut_elaborate-2.1: What is the difference between qualitative and quantitative data?
en.tut_elaborate-ql: Qualitative data describes things you observe using words: such as color, sounds, behavior.
en.tut_elaborate-qn: Quantitative data is measured precisely using numbers, instead of words: such as depth, pressure, temperature.
en.tut_elaborate-np: You can record all the data you observe/measure in your notepad.
en.tut_elaborate-sm-1: Great. Collecting both types of data is known as gathering empirical evidence.
en.tut_elaborate-sm-2: By asking questions, and answering them with empirical evidence, we can understand the deep ocean better.
en.tut_elaborate-sm-3: This process is known as the Scientific Method, use it as a guideline for your exploration.
en.tut_mb-1.2: Copy that. I'm ready to start.
en.tut_mb-end: Call us whenever need a recap. Good luck, SM-Explorer-2.
en.ch1_color-q: I wonder how the color of the ocean changes as I go deeper?
en.ch1_color-h1: The ocean color stays the same at all depths
en.ch1_color-h2: The ocean gets brighter and more colorful the deeper I go.
en.ch1_color-h3: The ocean gets darker and colors fade the deeper I go.
en.ch1_conch-2: Leave this place now... for your own good.
en.ch1_conch-2.1: No way, a talking shell?! That is so cool!
en.ch1_conch-2.1-1: Are you even listening... and don't call me a shell.
en.ch1_conch-4: Many have gone missing exploring this place. Turn back now while you still can.
en.ch1_conch-4.1: I can't leave yet. Not until I learn more about this place.
en.ch1_conch-4.1-1: Suit yourself... but know this, things change as you go deeper.
en.ch1_conch-5: You won't survive unless you understand those changes first.
en.ch1_enter-forest-1: I'm surrounded by thick strands of kelp. It's like a maze.
en.ch1_return-2: I see you have met the kelp monster.
en.ch1_return-3: It doesn't take kindly to intruders in their forest.
en.ch1_return-4: Kelp monster?! It must have tangled the propellor with kelp.
en.ch1_return-5: I have to go back to the ship to fix it.
en.ch1_return-6: I warned you kid... go home before it's too late.
en.ch1_return-7: There are spooky stories about this place for a reason.
en.ch1_return-8: Well, my dad used to tell me:
en.ch1_return-9: True scientists don't just listen to stories...
en.ch1_return-10: We use the Scientific Method, and learn the truth for ourselves.
en.ch1_return-12: Yes, he came here years ago, and never returned...
en.ch1_return-13: I'm not leaving until I find out what happened to him.
en.ch1_return-15: I see... then you must be prepared.
en.ch1_return-16: Asking the right questions is important...
en.ch1_return-17: You're on the right track... good luck, kid.
en.vent_desc-1: As the conch’s light cuts through the darkness, a hidden world is revealed.
en.vent_desc-2: In a place where sunlight has never touched, freezing water seeps down the gaps of the ocean bottom.
en.vent_desc-3: Mixing with the hot magma deep below, the water spews out as black smoke-like plumes…
en.vent_desc-4: ...forming great towering vents, shaped like chimneys.
en.vent_desc-5: Valuable minerals from deep within the earth are scattered across the sea floor - but that’s not all.
en.vent_desc-6: All sorts strange creatures and plants thrive here, feeding on the minerals and heat.
en.vent_desc-7: In the deepest, darkest, most crushing depths of the ocean, nothing should survive…
